alert.note: Alert for Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 12:50PM EST until March 08 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Kankakee River at Shelby affecting Newton and Lake IN Counties. Illinois River at La Salle affecting Bureau, La Salle and Putnam Counties. Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Newton and Iroquois Counties. Iroquois River near Foresman affecting Newton County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Iroquois River from Near I-65 east of Foresman downstream to near US-41 north of Kentland, including the Foresman gauge. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, 1000 South Road threatened north of the river near Brook. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 18.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM CST Tuesday was 18.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 12.4 feet through next Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by Wednesday morning.
